title: What artist has the most number one music hits? - Quora

response.answer_text: I compile data from the US Billboard charts. I am looking at only #1 songs, as the questions asks, not album sales. I am also looking at the number of weeks a song spent at #1. The Beatles (together and separate):36 #1 songs, 103 Weeks at #1 Breakdown: As The Beatles: 20 #1 songs, 59 weeks at #1; As Paul McCartney: 9 #1 songs, 30 weeks at #1; As John Lennon: 2 #1 songs, 6 weeks at #1; As George Harrison: 3 #1 songs, 6 weeks at #1; As Ringo Starr: 2 #1 songs, 2 weeks at #1. Elvis Presley:18 #1 songs, 91 total weeks at #1. Mariah Carey:14 #1 songs, 62 weeks at #1. Michael Jackson:13 #1 Songs, 39 weeks at #1. Madonna:11 #1 songs, 28 weeks at #1. Stevie Wonder:10 #1 songs, 25 weeks at #1. The Bee Gees:9 #1 songs, 27 weeks at #1. Elton John:9 #1 songs, 34 weeks at #1. Boys II Men:5 #1 Songs, 50 weeks at #1.

Well I have quite a few. Most of mine are around the 60’s and 70’s and since I tend to prefer music that never even saw a popularity chart, I’m sure their must be many people that have a lot more than I do. I would suggest it’s probably one of the bigger and older radio stations that play only chart hits, assuming they keep the records in their libraries rather than just chuck them. I once heard that there are some people who have so many songs in their collection that they could never listen to them all in their lifetime. Personally I don’t see the point, but someone like that might be a contender for having the most number one hit songs. OQ: Who has the most number one hit songs?
